question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Pay attention to ensure that the code you generate is executable. Please help me implement this SVG image using code: a black and white photo of a person's profile in a square.

checklist.title: Is the SVG profile image correctly implemented with proper element usage?
checklist.description: Check whether the SVG implementation uses appropriate elements (path, circle, rect, etc.) to create the profile silhouette. SVG should have proper viewBox and dimensions. Score 0 if no SVG is created, 5 if basic shapes are used but profile is not recognizable, 10 if the profile is clearly identifiable as a person's silhouette.

checklist.title: Is the black and white effect properly implemented?
checklist.description: Evaluate if the code correctly implements the black and white effect using appropriate SVG attributes (fill, stroke) or filters. Check that no colors other than black, white, and grayscale values are used. Deduct 5 points if colors are used, and 3 points if grayscale implementation is inefficient. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the profile image proportioned correctly in a square frame?
checklist.description: Verify that the SVG has equal width and height (perfect square), and the profile image is properly contained within the boundaries without awkward cropping. Deduct 5 points if the frame isn't square, 3 points if the profile doesn't fit properly within the frame. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the implementation include human facial features with appropriate detail?
checklist.description: Check if facial features (nose, lips, eye, ear outline, etc.) are properly defined in the profile view. Score 0 if no facial features are present, 5 if features are basic/crude, 10 if features are well-defined and proportionally accurate to create a realistic profile silhouette.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle different viewport sizes without distortion, includes appropriate fallbacks for SVG-unsupported browsers, and has clean, well-organized code structure. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no responsiveness or fallbacks are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Subtle animation on hover 2. Creative use of SVG filters for texture effects 3. Interactive elements that enhance the profile). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Unnecessary nested groups or elements 2. Verbose path definitions that could be simplified 3. Excessive filters or effects that don't contribute to the black and white profile aesthetic. Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core requirements are obscured by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review coding best practices like proper indentation, meaningful class/ID names, optimization of SVG paths, and appropriate documentation/comments. Deduct 5 points for excessive inline styles when classes would be more appropriate; deduct 5 points if the SVG has unnecessary precision in path coordinates; deduct 5 points if there are no comments explaining complex path structures. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the design follows principles of good silhouette design: 1) Clear contrast between figure and ground 2) Balanced negative space around the profile 3) Professional level of detail appropriate for SVG format. Deduct 3 points for poor figure-ground relationship, 5 points for awkward composition within the square, and 5 points for inappropriate level of detail (either too simplistic or needlessly complex). The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the file size and performance optimized?
checklist.description: Judge whether the SVG implementation is optimized for web use: 1) SVG code is minified or reasonably compact 2) Unnecessary metadata is removed 3) Path data is optimized without losing visual quality. Deduct 5 points for each unoptimized aspect: bloated path data, unnecessary attributes, or inefficient implementation that would cause rendering performance issues. The full score is 10 points.
